questions.answer_description:
Scenario: The order workflow fails to run upon initial deployment to Azure.
Deployment errors arise from conditions that occur during the deployment process. They appear in the activity log.
References:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-resource-manager/resource-group-audit
questions.question_text:
You need to troubleshoot the order workflow.
What should you do? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content: It should be trigger history and run histiry.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/logic-apps/logic-apps-diagnosing-failures

comments.content: In order to that URL: "Check trigger history" & "Check runs history". Thanks!
I don't think so. The logic app never runs, so the run history will be empty.
Great ref!, So the correct answer is A,C
Good one. Trigger History and Run History.

discussion.content: I believe the answer -- AD -- is correct. Check the trigger history to see if the problem is upstream, and no triggers are arriving. Check the activity log to check for deployment errors that prevent it running.

The correct answers are C and D.
Possible reasons for the failed execution are deployment and definition.
The deployment can be confirmed by D.
A definition check can be done with C.
A can only confirm the call of the trigger.
I think correct A and C ????A and

Why not Trigger history ? 
I think A,C correct
A & C is Correct

comments.content: There may be a mistake in the deployment operation and it may have failed to run. If this is the case, you need to examine the deployment operation.

Nope it says it will fail to run upon initial deployment.
So it got deployed but it could not run

discussion.content: it fails on deployment, not on execution, so i think D is correct
Why Trigger History?
Given answer it correct.

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
You need to correct the VM issues.
Which tools should you use? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//
questions.answer_description:
Backup and Restore: Azure Backup
Scenario: The VM is critical and has not been backed up in the past. The VM must enable a quick restore from a 7-day snapshot to include in-place restore of disks in case of failure.
In-Place restore of disks in IaaS VMs is a feature of Azure Backup.
Performance: Accelerated Networking
Scenario: The VM shows high network latency, jitter, and high CPU utilization.
Accelerated networking enables single root I/O virtualization (SR-IOV) to a VM, greatly improving its networking performance. This high-performance path bypasses the host from the datapath, reducing latency, jitter, and CPU utilization, for use with the most demanding network workloads on supported VM types.
References:
https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/blog/an-easy-way-to-bring-back-your-azure-vm-with-in-place-restore/

discussion.content: I got this question on my AZ-204 exam
I got this question in exam

Options : 
https://www.bravecertified.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Bravecertified-az-203-exam-questions-q9.jpg
The answer is correct btw.
options please :)

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
You need to implement the Log policy.
How should you complete the EnsureLogging method in EventGridController.cs? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
questions.answer_description:
Box 1: logdrop -
All log files should be saved to a container named logdrop.

Box 2: 15 -
Logs must remain in the container for 15 days.
Box 3: UpdateApplicationSettings
All Azure App Service Web Apps must write logs to Azure Blob storage.
References:
https://blog.hompus.nl/2017/05/29/adding-application-logging-blob-to-a-azure-web-app-service-using-powershell/

Instead ensure that signout events have a subject prefix. Create an Azure Event Grid subscription that uses the subjectBeginsWith filter.
Scenario: Authentication events are used to monitor users signing in and signing out. All authentication events must be processed by Policy service. Sign outs must be processed as quickly as possible.
questions.question_text:
Note: This question is part of a series of questions that present the same scenario. Each question in the series contains a unique solution that might meet the stated goals. Some question sets might have more than one correct solution, while others might not have a correct solution.
After you answer a question in this section, you will NOT be able to return to it. As a result, these questions will not appear in the review screen.
You need to ensure that authentication events are triggered and processed according to the authentication events policy.
Solution: Create a new Azure Event Grid topic and add a subscription for the events.
Does the solution meet the goal?

discussion.content: They key is "Sign outs must be processed as quickly as possible.", that means that you need to have a sign-out subscription to process those events faster

comments.content: There should be a separation between "sign-in" and "sign-out" and this solution doesn't guarantee that.

discussion.content: Why "NO"? Subscription with the filter for SignOut events will exclude SignIn events from processing. But "All authentication events must be processed by Policy service"

questions.answer_description:
Instead ensure that signout events have a subject prefix. Create an Azure Event Grid subscription that uses the subjectBeginsWith filter.
Scenario: Authentication events are used to monitor users signing in and signing out. All authentication events must be processed by Policy service. Sign outs must be processed as quickly as possible.

discussion.content: Should be A - Yes

comments.content:
Agree.
"A topic is used for a collection of related events." (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/event-grid/concepts#topics). Therefore, a single topic is enough for both event types and subscribers can filter out using subjectBeginsWith.

However, it is up to the 'SignOut' subscriber to process those events quickly.

Is this to support the requirement "Sign outs must be processed as quickly as possible." ? I think using subscription with filter, we are just passing the responsibility of "quick processing" to message receiver? The answer seems right, I am trying to understand the details around it.

discussion.content: Upon further analysis, I think the answer should be " Ensure that signout events have a subject prefix. Create an Azure Event Grid subscription that uses the subjectBeginsWith filter."
https://www.examtopics.com/discussions/microsoft/view/21683-exam-az-203-topic-24-question-25-discussion/

in other similar question A is the answer.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/event-grid/custom-topics - and here MS wrote: "For large solutions, create a custom topic for each category of related events."

comments.content: Exactly, that's what I don't understand.

discussion.content:
Microsoft says that Topics should be created for related events, using this logic.... Sign in and out events are part of the umbrella of Authentication events so you would rather just want to filter by the subject of the event to get the signout event or signin event..this is my thought process to understanding the correct answer

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/event-grid/concepts
The answer is A.
I'm fairly certain this should be A.

questions.question_text:
Note: This question is part of a series of questions that present the same scenario. Each question in the series contains a unique solution that might meet the stated goals. Some question sets might have more than one correct solution, while others might not have a correct solution.
After you answer a question in this section, you will NOT be able to return to it. As a result, these questions will not appear in the review screen.
You need to ensure that authentication events are triggered and processed according to the authentication events policy.
Solution: Create separate Azure Event Grid topics and subscriptions for sign-in and sign-out events.
Does the solution meet the goal?
